choices.E: You must manually copy the Node Manager files generated by the configuration Wizard into Node Manager home.
choices.A: You are using the Configuration Wizard to configure a script-based Node Manager.
choices.D: You are using the configuration Wizard to configure a Java-based Node Manager.
choices.B: The configuration Wizard prompts you to change the default Node Manager configuration values.
choices.C: The configuration Wizard bypasses all Node Manager Configuration.

questions.question_text:
You are creating a domain by using the Configuration Wizard. In the wizard, you select to configure Node Manager. Under "Node Manager Type", you select
"Manual Node Manager Setup".
What does this mean?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is C
Manual Node Manager Setup: This bypasses any node manager configuration by the wizard

The correct answer is C
Manual Node Manager Setup: This bypasses any node manager configuration by the wizard

questions.question_text:
You create a new Work Manager to control how server threads are allocated to an application's incoming requests. You want to further configure the criteria of the
Work Manager by using a Request Class.

Identify three valid Request classes that you can assign
to a Work Manager. (Choose three.)
You want to start the managed server called managed1 in "Standby" mode, to keep it as a "hot backup". Which statement about your domain configuration must be true?

choices.B: Your domain has an administration port.
choices.C: Only the admin server can start in "Standby" mode.
choices.A: The server managed1 must be of a cluster.
choices.D: There is no such thing as "Standby" mode.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Si no hay memoria, la mejor opción es la B
B? There is little memory but no shared file server constraint....

questions.question_text:
You require high availability for HTTP sessions in a web application. In addition, you have the following constraints:
"¢ There is little free memory on the machines hosting the cluster.
"¢ HA must be guaranteed even when multiple machines fail simultaneously.
"¢ You are not allowed to update the production databases schema.
Which is the best session persistence option?

You configure a data source with a non XA driver because your (non-Oracle) database does not provide XA drivers.
The data source will sometimes participate in global transactions with an EJB, so as you configure the data source you select "Supports Global Transactions" and
One-phase commit.
Why is this configuration wrong?

choices.A: You must choose an XA driver when a data source participates in global transactions.
choices.B: "One' Phase Commit" always returns "ready" during phase one of the two-phase commit process' so it is possible you will have heuristic errors in the database.
choices.D: "One-Phase Commit" only allows this data source to participate in global transaction, so you cannot have a global transaction that includes an EJB.
choices.C: "One-Phase Commit" processes this data source last in the global transactions, if the EJB must go last, you cannot use this configuration.
